You should use entire sentences when writing commit logs. Sentence starts with capital letter and ends with a dot. Keep this in mind, as ChangeLog files in releases are automatically generated from commit logs, and should look consistent. Don't use past forms in commit logs. For example write "Add foobar to function baz." not "Added foobar to function baz." (this is common practice).

There are some tools, you will probably find useful while helping us write all the software, and documentation related to the project. We try to keep this list complete, and up to date, but there still may be some pieces of software, that we forgot, as it seems natural for us to have it installed.
You need a .NET environment, and a C# compiler. There are several environments you can find.
These development frameworks provide you with a C# compiler which is required to build any program written with nemerle (including nemerle compiler itself).
To regenerate parser, you need jay (which is distributed with mono), and perl.
These are not prerequisites to do any task, but may be very helpful, and we ask you to use them, as they minimize amount of mistakes.

ispell -d american -h file.xml
or use your favorite development environment to do it for you.

To validate XML syntax use
xmllint --noout --xinclude file.xml
